nodes.label: Culture
nodes.title: Cultural identity, language, kinship, and ways of knowing.

nodes.label: Justice
nodes.title: Justice as process: law, fairness, responsibility, consequences.

nodes.label: Landscape
nodes.title: Place as character: mesas, canyons, roads, distance, weather.

nodes.label: Belief Systems
nodes.title: Spiritual practice, ceremony, taboos, ethics, balance.

nodes.label: Identity
nodes.title: Personal and communal identity shaped by history and place.

nodes.label: Language & Naming
nodes.title: Meaning carried in words, names, and translation.

nodes.label: Community & Kinship
nodes.title: Obligations, clan ties, social trust, reputation.

nodes.label: Tradition vs Modernity
nodes.title: Tension between contemporary life and older ways.

nodes.label: Outsiders & Contact
nodes.title: Cross-cultural misunderstanding, bias, cooperation, friction.

nodes.label: Ethics & Responsibility
nodes.title: What one owes to others; moral choices under pressure.

nodes.label: Order, Disorder, Balance
nodes.title: Restoring harmony after disruption; pattern vs noise.

nodes.label: Story & Meaning
nodes.title: How narrative explains events; memory, rumor, and truth.

nodes.label: Ceremony
nodes.title: Ritual acts as meaning-making and restoration.

nodes.label: Taboo & Transgression
nodes.title: Violations that create fear, stigma, or spiritual risk.

nodes.label: Healing & Balance (Hózhó)
nodes.title: Restoring harmony; wellness as relational.

nodes.label: Witchcraft & Skinwalkers
nodes.title: Fear of evil, corruption of power, spiritual danger.

nodes.label: Chindi (Ghost/Spirit)
nodes.title: Spirit of the dead; source of fear, contamination, and avoidance.

nodes.label: Four Sacred Mountains
nodes.title: Spiritual boundaries defining Navajo homeland and identity.

nodes.label: Diné (The People)
nodes.title: Navajo self-identity; what it means to be of the People.

nodes.label: Sand Paintings
nodes.title: Sacred healing art; temporary, powerful, not for outsiders.

nodes.label: Hopi-Navajo Relations
nodes.title: Complex neighboring cultures; land disputes, different worldviews.

nodes.label: Zuni Culture
nodes.title: Neighboring pueblo people; Shalako ceremony, different traditions.

nodes.label: Pueblo Communities
nodes.title: Settled village peoples; kivas, clowns, distinct ceremonies.

nodes.label: Poverty & Economics
nodes.title: Economic hardship underlying many crimes and choices.

nodes.label: Boarding School Legacy
nodes.title: Forced assimilation; cultural trauma across generations.

nodes.label: Uranium Mining
nodes.title: Cold War extraction; cancer, contamination, corporate negligence.

nodes.label: Alcoholism
nodes.title: Social devastation; personal struggle; community impact.

nodes.label: Tribal Police
nodes.title: Policing shaped by local relationships and jurisdiction.

nodes.label: Law vs Custom
nodes.title: Formal law interacting with customary norms and remedies.

nodes.label: Investigation & Evidence
nodes.title: Clues, logic, forensics, interviews, and inference.

nodes.label: Institutions
nodes.title: Courts, agencies, churches, schools, outside authorities.

nodes.label: Conflict & Power
nodes.title: Resource disputes, corruption, coercion, leverage.

nodes.label: Archaeology & Artifacts
nodes.title: Excavation, pot hunting, cultural patrimony, looting.

nodes.label: FBI
nodes.title: Federal jurisdiction on reservations; friction with tribal police.

nodes.label: Bureau of Indian Affairs
nodes.title: Federal oversight; bureaucracy, history of control.

nodes.label: National Park Service
nodes.title: Managing sacred and archaeological sites; access conflicts.

nodes.label: Motive (Greed, Revenge, Fear)
nodes.title: Why crimes happen; money, payback, desperation, secrets.

nodes.label: Smuggling Networks
nodes.title: Drugs, artifacts, contraband crossing remote borders.

nodes.label: Cold Cases
nodes.title: Unsolved mysteries; Leaphorn's specialty and obsession.

nodes.label: Sacred Sites
nodes.title: Places with spiritual meaning; boundaries of respect.

nodes.label: Ecology & Resources
nodes.title: Land use, extraction, scarcity, stewardship.

nodes.label: Distance & Isolation
nodes.title: Vast spaces affect timing, access, and vulnerability.

nodes.label: Weather & Time
nodes.title: Season, light, and time rhythms shaping events.

nodes.label: Boundaries & Jurisdiction
nodes.title: Where authority begins/ends; maps, roads, lines.

nodes.label: Window Rock
nodes.title: Navajo Nation capital; tribal police headquarters.

nodes.label: Shiprock
nodes.title: Sacred volcanic peak; Navajo origin stories; climbing taboo.

nodes.label: Canyon de Chelly
nodes.title: Ancient dwellings; sacred canyon; still inhabited.

nodes.label: Chaco Canyon
nodes.title: Ancestral Puebloan ruins; archaeological treasure; pot hunters.

nodes.label: Lt. Joe Leaphorn
nodes.title: Legendary detective; rational, experienced, skeptical of supernatural.

nodes.label: Sgt. Jim Chee
nodes.title: Young officer training as a medicine man; balances tradition and law.

nodes.label: Emma Leaphorn
nodes.title: Joe's beloved wife; her illness and death profoundly shape him.

nodes.label: Bernie Manuelito
nodes.title: Sharp young officer; becomes Chee's wife; own investigative instincts.

nodes.label: Louisa Bourebonette
nodes.title: Professor and Leaphorn's later companion; academic perspective.

nodes.label: The Blessing Way (1970)
nodes.title: First novel; introduces Leaphorn investigating a murder tied to Navajo witchcraft beliefs.

nodes.label: Dance Hall of the Dead (1973)
nodes.title: Edgar Award winner; Zuni boy's disappearance, clash of Navajo and Zuni cultures.

nodes.label: Listening Woman (1978)
nodes.title: Blind medicine woman witness; caves, sacred knowledge, and hidden treasure.

nodes.label: People of Darkness (1980)
nodes.title: Introduces Jim Chee; peyote church, uranium mining, and corporate crime.

nodes.label: The Dark Wind (1982)
nodes.title: Drug smuggling on Hopi-Navajo border; windmill, violated burial site.

nodes.label: The Ghostway (1984)
nodes.title: Chee tracks a witness to LA; urban vs reservation, ghost sickness.

nodes.label: Skinwalkers (1986)
nodes.title: First Leaphorn-Chee collaboration; witchcraft accusations mask deeper crimes.

nodes.label: A Thief of Time (1988)
nodes.title: Missing archaeologist; Anasazi ruins, pot hunting, obsession with the past.

nodes.label: Talking God (1989)
nodes.title: Smithsonian repatriation dispute; masks, museum politics, assassination plot.

nodes.label: Coyote Waits (1990)
nodes.title: Officer killed; elderly shaman suspect, Butch Cassidy legend, historical truth.

nodes.label: Sacred Clowns (1993)
nodes.title: Koshare clown murdered; gambling, school politics, pueblo secrets.

nodes.label: The Fallen Man (1996)
nodes.title: Skeleton on Ship Rock; climbing, land rights, decade-old disappearance.

nodes.label: The First Eagle (1998)
nodes.title: Plague research, murdered biologist; Hopi prophecy, science vs tradition.

nodes.label: Hunting Badger (1999)
nodes.title: Casino heist, militia connections; canyon country manhunt.

nodes.label: The Shape Shifter (2006)
nodes.title: Final novel; Leaphorn's cold case, Navajo rug, arson and revenge.
